title: HOW TO SETUP A WORM FARM + WHAT TO FEED WORMS | Vermicomposting | Hey It's A Good Life

tasks.task: Setting up a worm farm or bin.
subtasks: Gather necessary supplies (cardboard, browns, bedding, grit, worms, greens, amendments, bin, water).
Add layer of cardboard to fortify bin.
Include browns (shredded cardboard, newspaper, packing paper, or leaves) as bedding.
Add compost for organic material and to boost microbiome.
Introduce worms and provide grit (coffee grinds, eggshells, vermiculite) for digestion.
Cover worms with compost and soil to maintain humidity and shield from sunlight.
Add food scraps (bananas, avocados, apple cores, broccoli) sparingly for surface dwellers.
Cover food scraps with compost or soil to prevent pests and fruit flies.
Maintain bin moisture at "wrung out sponge" consistency, using filtered water.
Monitor moisture levels and adjust with browns if necessary.
Manage fruit fly issues by adding more browns and/or using traps.
Gradually increase food input as worm population grows.
Consider changing worm species (e.g., European nightcrawlers) for different purposes.
